front.title: Test Renditions for new RFC Headers & Boilerplate

abstract.t: This document contains test renditions for the new header and boilerplate values specified in RFC 5741, and reports on the implementation status for xml2rfc processors.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document contains test renditions for the changes specified in , as generated by an experimental version of rfc2629.xslt (see ). Its purpose is to illustrate the resulting text for all the variations of the various input parameters, and to track the changes applied to the proposal during the RFC-Editor's publication process.

section.title: Implementation Status for Xml2Rfc
section.t: Please join the xml2rfc mailing list () for discussion of changes to the RFC 2629 vocabulary ().

section.title: rfc2629.xslt (XML -> XSLT -> (X)HTML|XSL-FO)
section.t: The examples below were generated with an experimental version of rfc2629.xslt (see ).

section.title: xml2rfc.tcl (XML -> TCL -> TXT|HTML)
section.t: At the time of this writing, there was no work scheduled for updating xml2rfc, thus no direct conversion of XML source to TXT files is available (see ).

figure.artwork: Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) Request for Comments: 9999 Category: Standards Track ISSN: 2070-1721

section.title: Text of 'Status Of This Memo'
section.t: This is an Internet Standards Track document.

This document is a product of the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF). It represents the consensus of the IETF community. It has received public review and has been approved for publication by the Internet Engineering Steering Group (IESG). Further information on Internet Standards is available in Section 2 of RFC 5741.
Information about the current status of this document, any errata, and how to provide feedback on it may be obtained at http://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc9999.

front.title: Writing I-Ds and RFCs using XML

section.title: Since draft-reschke-hab-00
section.t: Updated to RFC 5741-to-be as of 2009-12-17: (i) expanded submission stream names, (2) replaced "RFC XXXX" by "RFC 5741".

section.title: Since draft-reschke-hab-01
section.t: Fix oversight: "Not all documents approved by the IESG are candidate for any level of Internet Standards" -> "Not all documents approved by the IESG are a candidate for any level of Internet Standard".

section.title: Since draft-reschke-hab-02
section.t: Remove a superfluous comma, and add examples for IRTF documents not coming from a RG.

section.title: Since draft-reschke-hab-03
section.t: Update draft reference to RFC 5741. Add RFC series ISSN number to headers (as implemented by RFC Editor).
